comment: He is a very tough grader. In my opinion I felt that he will take points off for a tiny mistake. I would definitely choose another professor if I had the choice. I felt that the grading system especially was very difficult.

I loved taking Prof.Sloop's class. He acted like he cared that each student could learn as long as they were showing him they were putting in some effort. He made himself available in the open math lab and was able to stay after class so students could work on homework with him in the room. He also gave many study materials and extra practice tools

Dr. Sloop is an incredible professor.  I am a non-traditional student and coming back to get some math classes to prepare for a PhD.  Do the practice exams over and over.  Ask for help.  If I can get an A after being out of math for 15 years, anyone can get an A if you apply yourself.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Would NOT recommend taking this professor. Genuinely the worst professor at KSU. Changes grades and will look for any excuse to submit a SCAI report. Will mark correct answers wrong to lower your grade. Should NOT be teaching at KSU. Take any other professor over him.

Professor Sloop was a great professor! You can tell he wants his students to succeed & he cares. There are a lot of extra credit opportunities throughout this course. There are group quizzes at the end of class when there is time. 2 Aleks assignments due per week, they're not too difficult. He's also open to constructive criticism:)

Extremely unique question formatting The entire math department uses Aleks and the final exam written by the department has questions that are the exact format as aleks questions unfortunately that's not the case with Mr sloop. Mentions partial credit for questions but that couldn't be further from the truth extremely harsh grader

No notecards on tests, and tests looked nothing like the study guides, which are tests from previous semesters. The tests also looked very different from the homework and notes that were covered. He's very nice, excited to teach, and helpful. But with his tests the way they are, and his fast pace, this is a difficult class to keep up in.

Professor Sloop was fantastic and my favorite professor this semester. I struggled initially, doubting I could pass after low grades on my first two tests. However, he encouraged us to attend after-class sessions and even adjusted his lessons based on our feedback. His support made a huge difference—I'd take all my math courses with him if I could.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Worst Professor here at KSU. Will accuse you of baseless accusation. Take anyone else.

Dr.Sloop is not a great teacher and if you have an option to choose any other, please do. I took this class because I saw previous reviews rating him as a great teacher but this course proved the exact opposite of that. As someone else said, he will use any and everything to submit a SCAI report.

Would recommend ANY other professor than Sloop. Will intentionally change grades to make you retake the course and will try to use any slight movement on proctored as a reason to submit a SCAI report. Very condescending in emails and holds grudges throughout semester. Has an ignorant personality - not the kind of person who should be teaching.
Sloop was an okay professor. I didnt enjoy his lectures and felt bored out of my mind
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Took this class as a dual-enrollment student. This is probably the best Calculus I professor on campus. He holds group quizzes at the end of each class, which almost acts as a way to counteract the lack of campus culture. If you engage in this class and like math you will absolutely have a blast learning about math. Do yourself a favor and take him

Overall, pretty good. He does take student feedback and generally changed how he taught the content with the notes he had. Also does group work for nearly every topic we learn every class, so they were very useful. I'd recommend

I 100% recommend taking Dr. Sloop for calculus. He pays so much attention to detail, and genuinely wants his students to succeed. He takes feedback after exams and alters the course based on our needs. We take group "quizzes" at the end of every class which is super helpful. He also crochets stuffed animals to hand out as review rewards!!

I would definitely recommend Professor Sloop for Calculus 1. The first time I took calc I had to drop the class. This time I ended with an A. Professor Sloop is great at teaching the material. He is extremely helpful when answering questions and his notes are easy to comprehend. You can tell he genuinely cares.

I loved him and his class. It was an easy A for me, but some people struggled. If you go to class and pay attention you will do fine. He really wants you to succeed. Take advantage of asking questions when working on in-class assignments; he is specific on the wording he wants you to use.

One of the most understanding professors I've had. Very accessible outside of class. Lecture heavy and quizzes every session. Not as bad as it sounds. 3 exams for each unit, and grade on final can replace exam grade if the score is higher. Good amount of extra credit. Would take again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Sloop is the BEST teacher you will ever take. He is awesome wants you to succeed and offers so many office hours. Additionally, before the test, he outlines what will be on it. He is far from "power-tripping". If you need to take Calc Sloop is the best as they come. He also gives extra credit and is a very lenient grader when it comes to tests.

This class was made confusing for unnecessary reasons. On tests you must answer his questions in an exact way that he likes or you will lose points. If you miss a test that grade can only be made up on the final which can screw you over. If there is a better professor I would recommend them over him for this course.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: he is the best, take him. he gives you all of the notes so you always have something reliable to look back on. the group quizzes help so much and it is another great thing to study apart from the study guides (which are literally the test). replaces the tests with the final. he makes the class really easy.

Although this course was difficult, i'm sure it won't be for those who understand math however I'm not one of those people. The way he grades tests, and the final exam makes it where you have a very high chance of passing, and he gives extensions on any assignments you may have missed. This class is very passable you just need to put in effort :)

I took his pre-calc course and would say he is a decent teacher. If you are not comfortable teaching yourself certain criteria, then I do not recommend taking him. He does give you homework and what he calls "group quizzes" every week as well. Overall a decent professor but can be difficult in his way of teaching. Take with some caution.
unreasonable and power tripping

Took him online for precalc in the summer. He's a pretty easy grader. Gives a lot of supplementary videos and stuff along with his lectures to help with the class. Has study guide before every test and final. As long as you do your homework, and the study guide, you'll be good. He's also pretty calm.

I took this class online and it was extremely easy. His lectures and homework are very helpful. His tests are also very easy because he provides a study guide with the exact same format as the test (test just has different numbers and only 12 questions). He's also very communicative and understanding. He provides you with everything to get an A.

take him. he gives many opportunities to excel in the class. the group quizzes help a lot and you will always get a 100 on those. the homework is not heavy, he gives study guides for tests, the quizzes are another form of study, and the aleks study guide is exactly like the actual test. he replaces test grades with the final. wish he taught calc 1.

3 tests and a final, no curve no notecard. Group work at the end of each class but this groupwork is super beneficial, so please take him - the group work questions and the in-class review are essentially the test questions, he offers 3 extra credit quizzes. If you have to take anything higher than pre-calc TAKE HIS CLASS, it will help.

His way of teaching calculus is very straight-forward and he uses somewhat informal language to explain things so that we'll understand it better. He doesn't make you do the pre-homework practice on ALEKS, which if you have had to endure that before, it feels like a weight being lifted off your shoulders. He also has SI's who are very helpful.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Pretty cool guy. You definitely need to show up for class because every class you have group activity to finish for a grade. Tests are just like study guides. He splits homework in half through the week so you have 2 Aleks assignments due each week.

Great teacher who cares about his students. Provides group quizzes at end of each lecture to review material which is extremely helpful for tests. Tests are straightforward and covers class material. Take him if you can. Easy to comprehend lectures and explains material well. Provides fill-in notes as well.

I'm shocked by these low ratings?!?! If you come to class, this course is an easy A. He moves quickly through the lecture to allow time for group work EVERY class. He'll help you with the group work, and his test questions all come from the group work. Also, he's obsessed with x-mas and dressed as Buddy the Elf for our final. Hilarious!

Loved Dr. Sloop! Attendance doesn't count for a grade, but there are in-class assignments and quizzes that cannot be made up. Offers a lot of extra credit to make up for missing class though. Hilarious guy! Quizzes and tests are indicative of what we learn in class, go to class and get an easy A!

I'm really surprised that Dr. Sloop's rating isn't higher as he was a phenomenal professor. His lectures are structured, easy to follow, and he always answers questions well. The tests are similar to the study guides and the homework is manageable. I highly recommend Dr. Sloop.
He did group quizzes every class for my section, and they were so helpful. His test questions are pulled from the quizzes and has a lot of extra credit opportunities.
He makes sure you know what is expected but he teaches the material very clearly. I am not someone who is good at math however I would have failed if I hadnt have taken him. he's amazing

idk why all these people rated him so bad, do not listen to them. I had precalc and this man is one of the best math teachers I have ever had. He explains things so well and shows lots of examples for every type of problem. You will have homework every night but its math, its expected. In class quizzes every day, but all open note w/ a group.

Dr Sloop is hands down the best math professor. He explains each concept with extreme detail, moves at a comfortable pace, and walks everyone through daily learning activities without blatantly giving the answers to ensure that every student makes a 100 and can confidently perform problems without a sweat. He is entertaining, patient, and EASY!!!

Professor sloops do talk fast, but he is linear. He assigns ALEX homework weekly. He also gives a group class week each class with 3-4 questions. He will answer any questions you have. His tests have 15-20 questions, but he always has extra credits and offers office hours, so I'd be surprised if you fail this class.

WORST PROFESSOR. 
I cannot believe KSU has such a rude unreasonable teacher. His lectures are not planned out well and he be all over the place making it hard to keep up with the class. Save yourselves the trouble. Take anyone else!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Just dropped his class
Do not take sloop this guy is a bad teacher. Better off waiting or taking a different professor.
Take someone else
This guy is such a clown do not take

Do not take Sloop. He is a nice guy but his class is structured in such a way that it makes it nearly impossible to take any other class. I took calc and got an A easy but in this guys class he gives so much homework that takes literally hours.

This man is a unicorn. He just knows how to teach math. His lectures might be boring but its not because of him its the topic. He really goes the extra mile to make sure everyone understands. Dont be afraid to ask questions if you have them. He uses ALEKS for hw so just be prepared for that. IF YOU WANT TO PASS MATH TAKE HIM!!
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor sloop prints out notes for the whole semester for students to use during class. The notes are fill in the blank and are super helpful to use when you do the ALEKS homework. He typically spends the day going over the notes and then have practice problems at the end of class. He will answer any questions you have and overall he's great!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Sloop is a very boring teacher. His lectures are very dry and he is not good at explaining problems. I am using my prior knowledge of the subject and joined a study group for extra help. He mostly uses Aleks for the assignments, which isn't bad since I used this site in the past. I would not recommend him if you're looking for more interaction
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Sloop is honestly one of the best teachers Ive ever had. I have taken calculus before and had to drop out because I was failing but Professor Sloop actually cared and was extremely helpful when needed.

Dr. Sloop is a very good teacher! I took calculus before, but I withdrew, since I had bad gaps in math and my previous teacher was not that good. Dr. Sloop explains clearly and his tests are fair! Additionally, I didn't spend a dime on tutoring because of his office hours. Very good teacher! Lots of group-work! Tests similar to quizzes & HW.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He is a nice guy who really knows about math and teaching. He shows he cares that you learn and are succesful. Sometimes he relies too much on ALEKS (which is a half decent site) and counts on you to keep up with the material. Tests are not too hard if you pay attention and put in the work. He really tries to be a good teacher, and mostly succeeds.
